name: Time Dilation
explanation: Time dilation: moving clocks run slower. Time interval in moving frame (Δt) equals proper time (Δt₀) times Lorentz factor γ. This is a real effect, not an illusion - confirmed by experiments with atomic clocks and particle accelerators. Explains why muons reach Earth's surface (they live longer in our frame). Fundamental to special relativity.

examples.problem: Muon lifetime is 2.2μs in rest frame. If moving at 0.99c, what is lifetime in lab frame?
Why do GPS satellites need relativity corrections?
examples.solution: Time runs faster in weaker gravity, slower due to orbital speed
steps: General relativity: time runs faster at higher altitude
Special relativity: time runs slower due to speed
Net effect: GPS clocks run faster

proof: Δt = γΔt₀ where γ = 1/√(1-v²/c²). Derived from Lorentz transformations. Light clock: photon bouncing between mirrors. In moving frame, path is longer (hypotenuse), so time runs slower. Confirmed by experiments with atomic clocks and muons.
